summary: Mobile repairing service app for Rconnect with customer booking, online payments, distinct service/repairing sections, gallery-style UI, and a high-level shop presentation/profile including shop photo, contact numbers, and address.
known_issues: Logo is not visible for users ("Logo dikh nahin raha hai")

existing_features.title: Create a customer-facing mobile repair app for "Rconnect" with a clear navigation structure that includes: Shop (home/profile), Services/Repairs (categorized), Gallery (gallery-style browsing), Booking, Payments, and Contact/Address.

Implement a Shop Profile / high-level shop presentation screen that prominently displays: shop name (Rconnect), the provided contact numbers (Rconnect mobile: 8055788280; Customer care: 8828088284), and the provided address (Shop no 07, Dream House Building, Sai Nagar, Vasai West, Vasai-Virar, Maharashtra 401202).
Add support for displaying the user-provided shop photo in the Shop Profile screen as a hero/banner image, stored as a static frontend asset.
Build a gallery-style browsing experience ("same to same gallery") for shop content/services: a responsive grid of cards/thumbnails with a detail view (modal or dedicated page) for each item.
Create categorized "Repairing/Services" sections (separate sections) so customers can browse offerings in an organized way (e.g., Screen/Display, Battery, Charging, Software, Water Damage, Other).

Implement a customer booking system that allows customers to submit a repair booking request including at least: customer name, phone number, device model, issue description, preferred date/time (or preferred contact time), and optional photo/notes field (if file upload is not supported, provide a text-only alternative). Persist bookings in the Motoko backend.
Add a shop-side Bookings view in the frontend to list submitted bookings and view booking details (read-only is acceptable unless status updates are implemented).

Add a Payments section dedicated to "Online payment" information for repairs. Because third-party payment gateways may not be available, provide an in-app payment instructions screen that can display payment methods/instructions and record a customer's declared payment intent/method as part of a booking (e.g., Cash/UPI/Card on delivery) or as a separate submission.

Choose and apply a coherent visual theme for the entire app (colors, typography, spacing, component style) suitable for a professional mobile repair shop. Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette. Enforce the theme consistently across all screens.
Add a new Customer Reviews page in the React frontend that displays existing reviews in a clean, mobile-friendly layout and provides a form for customers to submit a new review.
Expose Customer Reviews in the app navigation so users can easily find the reviews screen.

Add a static Rconnect logo image asset and display it at the top of the app in the main Header (desktop) and in the mobile menu header area, replacing or supplementing the current wrench icon logo mark.
Ensure the logo image is responsive and visually aligned within the header without breaking the existing navigation layout across common viewport sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop).

Add the uploaded logo image (download.webp) to the frontend as a static asset at the exact path `/assets/generated/rconnect-logo.dim_512x512.png`, so the app uses the uploaded logo when rendering the logo image.

Place/display the Rconnect logo image in the Shop page hero section (ShopPage) in addition to the header, ensuring it remains readable on top of the hero image/gradient in both light and dark themes and across mobile/tablet/desktop viewports.

Replace the currently used Rconnect logo asset with the newly uploaded image (download-1.webp) while keeping the existing frontend logo path stable at `/assets/generated/rconnect-logo.dim_512x512.png`, so the Header and ShopPage hero continue to render the updated logo without code changes beyond the static asset update.

Add a new public (non-admin) page that shows a read-only list of all submitted bookings visible to everyone (no login required), including a details view per booking. This page must not allow updating booking status.
Expose the new public All Bookings page in the main navigation so users can easily find it on both desktop navigation and the mobile menu.

Fix the logo visibility issue so the Rconnect logo reliably renders for all users in both the Header (desktop + mobile sheet) and the ShopPage hero area. Add an explicit image-load fallback (e.g., show shop name text or a simple mark) when `/assets/generated/rconnect-logo.dim_512x512.png` fails to load, and ensure the logo remains readable across light/dark themes and common viewport sizes.

Remove people/human imagery from the visible website content by replacing any hero/banner/gallery images that contain people with device/repair-focused imagery only (phones, repair tools, parts, close-ups of devices).

Add a refreshed set of gallery visuals showing mobile repairing for major device families (Android through iPhone). Update `frontend/src/data/galleryItems.tsx` so multiple gallery items render real images (via the `image` field) using new static assets placed under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`, while keeping the existing gallery card + dialog behavior intact.

Add a simple 'New update' visual enhancement to improve the overall look and clarity: add a 'Brands We Repair' section on the Shop page featuring Android and iPhone plus a few popular Android brands, using clean brand-style icon tiles and consistent spacing/typography with the current amber/orange theme.

Update the booking UI so that the device model is consistently presented as “Model Name” in all booking-related screens and dialogs (customer booking form, public bookings details dialog, and admin bookings details dialog), ensuring the existing `deviceModel` value is what is displayed.
